New breg-class object

Source: R/01-class.R
breg.Rd

New breg-class object

Usage

breg(
  y = NULL,
  x = NULL,
  x2 = NULL,
  group_by = NULL,
  data = NULL,
  config = NULL,
  models = list(),
  results = NULL,
  results_tidy = NULL
)

Arguments

y

Character vector representing dependent variables.

x

Character vector representing focal variables.

x2

Character vector representing control variables, optional.

group_by

Character vector representing group by column, optional.

data

A data.frame containing the data for modeling.

config

Configurations for model construction.

models

List of model.

results

A data.frame containing the result data of models (from broom.helpers::tidy_plus_plus()).

results_tidy

A data.frame containing the tidy result data of models (from broom::tidy()).

Examples

obj <- breg("y", letters[1:5], LETTERS[1:5])
obj
#> A object of <breg> class
#> • Y: y
#> • X:
#>   • focal variables: a, b, c, d, and e
#>   • control variables: A, B, C, D, and E
#> • group_by:
#> • data: <df[,0]>
#> • config:
#> • models: <list: >
#> • results: <df[,0]>
#> 
#> Focal variables (or primary variables) are injected into the model one by one,
#> while covariates (or control variables) remain constant across all models in
#> the batch.
print(obj, raw = TRUE)
#> <bregr::breg>
#>  @ y           : chr "y"
#>  @ x           : chr [1:5] "a" "b" "c" "d" "e"
#>  @ x2          : chr [1:5] "A" "B" "C" "D" "E"
#>  @ group_by    : NULL
#>  @ data        :'data.frame':	0 obs. of  0 variables
#>  @ config      : NULL
#>  @ models      : list()
#>  @ results     :'data.frame':	0 obs. of  0 variables
#>  @ results_tidy:'data.frame':	0 obs. of  0 variables
#>  @ n_x         : int 5
#>  @ n_x2        : int 5
#> NULL
